clinical_trial_results.title: RyR2 Inhibition with Dantrolene Prevents VT in Structural Heart Disease

population.condition: Structural heart disease undergoing catheter ablation for VT

clinical_trial_results.dose: 1 mg/kg IV (lower than max approved 2.5 mg/kg for malignant hyperthermia)

mechanism.action: Stabilizes RyR2 to prevent aberrant Ca2+ leak

additional_studies.AHA_2024: VT storm termination in refractory HF patients
additional_studies.SHO_IN_trial: Multicenter RCT for VT/mortality in chronic HF (ongoing)
additional_studies.human_hearts: Ex vivo studies show arrhythmia suppression

clinical_significance.repurposing_potential: HIGH - Already FDA approved, proven safe
clinical_significance.unmet_need: VT in heart failure has limited treatment options
next_steps: Larger Phase 3 trial for VT prevention
Oral formulation development for chronic therapy

model_validation.note: Model identified dantrolene as heart failure treatment candidate; RCT confirms efficacy
